title: England combined XV from four Rugby World Cup finals: how many of Eddie Jones heroes make the cut, and who from 2003 misses out?
text:
With England reaching the final of the Rugby World Cup for the third time since the turn of the millennium, fans of the Red Rose will rightly claim that they have watched many of the true greats of the game down the years.

England will face South Africa in Yokohama on Saturday in a re-run of the 2007 final which England lost 15-6. Eddie Jones’ side are 80 minutes away from sporting immortality, if only they can avoid a repeat of the result.

But how does this side compare to those of the past, and who among the current England squad would get into an all-time XV?

It’s all subjective, obviously, but let’s take a stab at putting together the greatest ever England team.

All-time XV

15 – Anthony Watson...
description: With England reaching the final of the Rugby World Cup for the third time since the turn of the millennium, fans of the Red Rose will rightly claim that they have watched many of the true greats of the game down the years.
